channel.title: R on It works
channel.description: Recent content in R on It works

item.title: This is a new post
item.description: Is this how you add in stuff? 1 + 1 ## [1] 2 rnorm(10) # 10 random numbers ## [1] -0.4324180 0.2561106 0.0100047 0.9054032 0.0193092 -0.9927873 ## [7] -0.3972822 -2.6278047 -2.0962900 -1.3466407 plot(dist ~ speed, cars) # a scatterplot This is another test at how to add in stuff library(babynames) ## Warning: package 'babynames' was built under R version 3.4.4 library(dplyr) ## Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 3.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
